alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 16 at 4:32AM CST until February 16 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS AND RIO GRANDE VALLEY THURSDAY... .A cold front will bring in low humidity and gusty northwest winds this morning. When combined with cured fuels and moderate to severe drought conditions, this could lead to the rapid and erratic spread of wildfires. Conditions will improve rapidly after sunset Thursday with diminishing winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR STRONG WINDS, CURED FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR BROOKS, INLAND KENEDY, HIDALGO, INLAND WILLACY, AND INLAND CAMERON COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds, cured fuels, and low relative humidity values, which is in effect from noon today to 5 PM CST this afternoon. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect and has been upgraded to a Red Flag Warning. * AFFECTED AREA...Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron and Northern Hidalgo. * TIMING...12 PM TO 5 PM. * WINDS...North 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 24 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 60s. * LIGHTNING...Very low chance. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Brooks; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo
